Почти тот самый Dungeon Keeper. Почти. В сравнении с предыдущими частями огромный шаг вперед, даже действующую камеру пыток посмели реализовать, хотя был уверен, что не решатся. 39418051.review:
Short version:
* The campaign is fun to play through
* The narration is amusing
* Co-op is interesting to try
* The interface is clunky
* Multi-player (versus) is bad
* Skirmishes are either way too long or unsatisfying

Long version:
The game keeps asking me to share my thoughts, so I'm finally doing so.  My brother and I got the game so we could play co-op together after I enjoyed Dungeons 2 a lot.  I played the campaign solo on normal difficulty (we did one or two campaign stages co-op) and played a bunch of solo and co-op skirmishes on basically all the different settings.  We also tried out the mutliplayer (1 on 1).

The game does a good job of giving you a fun build-a-dungeon experience while adding in that missing element of attacking the overworld.  The narration is also fun.  I still find myself wanting to play it, even though I've pretty much done everything.  One thing to note is that the game is pretty easy, which I think is good since there's so much to manage at once, but if you're looking for something super challenging, this game will not do that for you.

Co-op mode is pretty interesting and this game definitely lends itself easily to a division of labor since there are two distinct zones in every game (the dungeon and the outside world).  We ended up essentially dividing things up by building versus fighting/troop-related stuff.

Interface:
The interface really bothers me.  It does this thing where it expands stuff out to block the rest of the screen.  In some cases, I guess it's okay (like the research screen), but in other cases it's terrible.  For example, I never use any spells - not because the spells are useless, but because the interface to, say, use a damage spell during a fight, requires me to cover up the fight on my screen to use it.  They have shortcut keys, but you have to try the spells out before you memorize the shortcut keys before you learn which spells you even want to memorize the shortcut keys for.  A catch-22.  This is the most egregious example of the interface issues, but they come up frequently.  A minor example is if you want to build a door, but accidentally click on the button for building a room and now it's a big hassle to switch back.  These issues aren't enough to make me not play the game, but they are enough to limit how much I explore the available options.

A lot of the things you can do in the game are also hidden in the background.  Like, I figured out a lot of the things I could do through either looking at the hints during the loading screens or by digging through the keyboard options.  Some of the stuff is pretty important, like being able to pick up all minions in your dungeon that aren't doing something important (F3) or how to destroy a minion you don't want (put it on the grate by the dungeon heart and slap the lever), but you're probably never going to figure out what they are.  Like, is there a way to pick up some or all of my worker dudes?  It would be super helpful if there was, so there probably is, but I have no idea how.

Sometimes your minions get angry about something.  Like if you forget to build food for them and they're hungry.  So they go on strike and you get a notification.  You can even look at your army list and see which ones are mad.  But you can't figure out why they're mad unless you wait for them to walk to your dungeon heart and hold up a cryptic sign indicating what they want.  Especially if you're making a long maze to get to your dungeon heart, this doesn't help.

At the time of this writing, there are still some bugs in the game.  For example, the books that boost a minion's abilities sometimes disappear if you leave them in a treasury for too long.  We first noticed this playing co-op when one of us would be able to see the book and the other wouldn't (like, I was building out the dungeon while he was fighting outside and I found a book and told him to put it on a guy but he couldn't even see it).  Since then, I've observed it happening in solo play as well.

My biggest request for a new feature would be a queue.  Like, you say I want to research these 4 things in this particular order and as soon as the resources are available, it happens automatically.  This would be ESPECIALLY helpful for co-op play if both players could add to or reorder the queue.

Also, I want to see maps of other underground areas I have visited/can visit (with fog of war, I assume).

Skirmishes:
Once you've finished the campaign, the other thing you can do is play skirmishes, which are randomly generated levels where you build a dungeon and either go defeat a boss or survive a bunch of waves of enemies.

Regular: I have to say that defeating a boss is super anticlimactic.  I have literally sent an army of like 5 guys towards a boss expecting them to just die off while I go work on fortifying my defenses and then suddenly the game ends and I've somehow won.  I don't know if it needs tougher boss fights or more pomp and circumstance when you're battling a boss or what, but it is always a let-down.  I just spent an hour making an impenetrable dungeon and taking over the whole map and I can just send a fully upgraded Thalya in to fight the boss alone and I win without doing anything special.  One idea I had was that when you defeat a boss, it gives you a countdown and then unleashes a giant wave of enemies into your dungeon.  Not saying that would solve it, but it would at least do something interesting.

Survival: I don't know about other players, but I played on "hellish" mode on every map combination and I was always finished with everything (both building and conquering) by wave 15 and had to basically sit around waiting for 30 minutes for the game to end.  I need a button to insta-summon the next wave or something, like in any halfway decent tower defense game.

Multiplayer (Versus):
I understand that there's this idea that every game that comes out must have a multiplayer mode, but this just isn't fun to play.  There are two modes.  In one, you see who can max out their evilness first (i.e. you're constantly trying to take each other's islands of evilness away) and in the other you're trying to destroy the opponent's dungeon heart.  In both modes, you have to spend a lot of time doing the RTS above-ground part of the game.  Frankly, that's the least interesting part of the game by far.  If you're trying to get the most evilness, then you only have a minor motivation to work on your dungeon beyond a certain point.  If you're trying to kill the other guy, you need to get enough evilness to build your defenses, so you have to keep taking the islands or defending them (and you can't build defenses).

Deathmatch: Traps in this game can be quite powerful and the only way to stop them is to wear them out.  I suppose it might be possible to send in one guy to trigger the trap and then send the rest of the army in to blow up a door, but if you imagine a hallway filled with ice spike traps and ice crushers, you can probably imagine that you're not going to get very far.  I built a full-size army which included all three titans and couldn't get past my brother's first door.  He didn't bother sending any troops to fight me.  So your only real option is to blow through your opponent's dungeon before they can get a solid defense in place.  But the game explicitly stops you from entering your opponent's dungeon until you have a powerful army by putting automated defenses on all entrances.  I was easily able to build a solid defense before my opponent was able to get inside.

I can think of a few things that might (might!) make the multiplayer game more fun:
* Reserve an island of evilness for each player that is attacked by waves of neutral enemies, but is not accessible to opponents.
* Option to send waves of enemies into your opponent's dungeon
* A spell that disables traps for a long period of time or that destroys all traps in an area
* Co-op in Multiplayer



Anyway, fun game!

39340375.review:
Throughout the whole game I never tought about DK 1 or 2 to compare. This game is it's own game and it excels in what it does. While I was happy that some maps felt a bit like Dungeons 1, I do hope they return to that game mode at one point.

The story wasn't as twisty as Dungeons 2 but it was just enough not to feel empty but not too much to annoy you. Again these guys are masters of ballance.

The game really can be played in multiple ways. YÍou just pick one and go to town with it. meaning composition, build order, research order etc. Im saying this beacuse a certain set is enough to win all levels on hellish difficulty wich trully test your skills. One fuck up and bam most if not all of your troops gone. While you might feel gold is a bit too much once you unlock the arena you will struggle to keep it above 0, so again it is ballanced to endgame, and there is always something to spam resources if you feel stacked up.

Not too hard not too difficult and it always keept me busy. Whomever says it is slow then they just don't do anything, they play safe. What you can do. You can rush, play safe whatever its highly adaptoble, i find it unlikelly that there is someone who can't find his/her playstile in it.

While the game will maybe feel too long the amount of content in it is INSANE there is SOOO MUCH STUFF its unreal. I like how they build up the importance of some things, then say HEY there is several EXTRA levels of that stuff. and when you feel satisfied they turn around and DOUBLE most things up in variation that trully matters and you just feel christmass is real.

One mayor complait tho: The UI (aside from the research tab) is COMPLETE SHIT, its unbearable, i played the whole game through and still couldnt get used to the unit tabs. I cant fucking belive it. I never tought a UI can be so bad you just cant comprehend it no matter how much time you use it. Holy shit who ever designed the left tabs must be mental. For the love of EVIL put the unit spawner and counter on the top of the tab once opened and put the unit roaster below it. So if you look up you see how much you have and instantly replenish if one dies, Just just do it, that one tab can quite literally drive ppl away i swear. The building tab is okay ish but you should really really increase the space beatween buttons, cuz they look soo simmilar due to theire diamond icons.

39317682.review:
I am really enjoying this game - it is a lot slicker than Dungeons 2 and the UI takes a little getting used to. Once you do, it makes everything so much smoother and easier than its predecessor. 
The only minor criticism that I have so far (just reached the final level) is that the same tactic works on pretty much every stage of the campaign. There are 3 factions - horde, demons, undead and all of the missions can be cleared using only the horde faction without too much difficulty. I will no doubt replay the game and see if the same can be achieved using only undead or only demons but I would have liked to have seen some synergy between the races and a requirement to mix your team up a little.

39303820.review:
The Evil-enjoying Evil has decided that this game improves many mechanics, which it saw during the conquering of Dungeons 2. 
So the Sequel-Underestimating Evil knew it had to write a review. 

The Critical-Thinking Evil started its rant about the aspects its Dungeon had outflawed since its last Crusade.

For starters the Diversity-Supporting Evil knew that always splitting the Horde, Demons and Undead into seperate Dungeons would certainly bring some sub-society into its ranks, so it decided there needed to be diversity in every Dungeon it build and therefore it made sure it would be able to recruit lackeys of all factions into the same Dungeon!

The next improvement the Unit-Upgrading Evil made, is the possibility for its Troopers to instantly get the advantages of the upgrades it researched and instantly could make use of them against those Unicorn-cuddling Rainbow-farting forces of good!


Even though the Competition-crushing Evil has not fought another Dungeonlord yet, it can safely say that the conquering of the forces of good is a great pleasure and it relishes every moment of the houses burning and the farmers screaming in agony.
Well as long as its new schizophrenic general and the easily offendable narrator arent fighting about whos job has a future or not.

In the end the Not-knowing-what-to-say-other-than-a-great-continuation Evil just tells everyone that if they enjoyed the last 2 Dungeons games, this is a great way to continue that love.

And I would have forgiven a handful - this game includes them in every scene, almost every line of dialogue. And  there is a LOT of dialogue. The gameplay itself was relatively simple compared to the predecessors, too. Might be fun for kids with no connection to Dungeon Keeper.

39260096.review:
This is not a good game on so many levels. 

I am going to compare this to Dungeon keeper 2 becase I think that a moden game should atleast try to surpass it. 

The possibility to go above ground is refreshing but from there it gets extremly flat. The maps miss proper design and consist more of random stacks of units placed instead of that you acctually assult a human fortress or other locations. From watching the trailer I had high hopes for this game but allready after 3 hours I gave up on this. 

compared to DK2:
+ You can replace walls which is something that was not possible in DK2
- Funnier rooms and more gameplay mechanics in DK2. creatures integrating with different rooms. 
-Most creatures are just upgrades and not original creatures. DK2 had a much better feel of originality and speciality to each creature. 
- just pooooooorly made in everything from sound to design and gameplay. 
-No open spaces underground. just dirt everywhere. Almost nothing happends while exploring. 
-What was that campaing (cancer)? 


long version:
 
-The sound for combat animations is sometimes missing or non existing. 
-The controls and menus are not as easy to use as you would think and there is no way to summon your creaters for most of the game except to open a seperate menu and click on each one. You can also not rotate the view. 
-The dungeon part of the map is inhabited by different creatures but after awhile you feel no kind of excitment for encountering them. there is no excitment to dig further and discover things on the map like it was in DK2 where there could be outposts and hugh lava seas. Here everything is just stone. 
-There is a major flaw in the game mechanic which is hard to describe but for resources they kinda stop mattering quite soon in the begining since you will get more gold than you can spend quite fast without any problems. The rooms therefore feels unaccomplished and you just build them for the sake of it. 
-Don't get me started on the campaing. The dialogs and the world is so poorly done that you can hardly see that they are trying to be funny.

39258578.review: Reminds me of dungeon keeper on DOS but id love to see a vs where the players control the overworld and heroes while vsing the underworld

39257378.review:
[h1] Dungeons 3 [/h1] 

Quando vc nao achava que eles podiam melhorar o segundo  game, se enganou rapazinho, eles nao so melhoraram em cada aspecto, mas agora tem mapas gerados aleatoriamente, para lhe garantir horas infinitas de torturas de humanos gananciosos hahahaha... 

Seguindo o sucesso e as mecanicas que todo mundo amava desde o seu segundo game, onde vc é Mal encarnado e nao o bonzinho como na maioria daqueles games sem graça, mas melhorando em cada aspecto e trazendo mais conteudo ainda, uma campanha maior, mapas gerados aleatoriamente para trazer uma gameplay diferente a cada vez q inicia o game, e outras coisas como:
Raças que vc pode jogar: Horda (orcs, nagas, goblins, ogros), Demonios e Mortos vivos
É lindo ver seus servos trabalhando nas dungeons, suas animações, humanos presos, ou sendo torturados, snots fazendo cerveja e por ai vai, animações muito tops, graficos muito bonitos e artisticos, sendo muito leves, o game rodando lisinho e super otimizado por causa desse grafico mais artistico.

No game vc pode se especializar em cada uma das raças ou ser hibrido e ter 2 ou 3 raças, com suas vantagens e desvantagens. O jogo tem uma arvore de habilidades enorme, com novas armadilhas, mais recursos, novas salas como a prisao, onde pode torturar os herois marditos e transforma-los em esqueletos, zumbis, ouro, ou sacrifica-los no altar para lhe invocar, o mau supremo. Cada raça sendo bem unica e diferente de jogar, aumentando ainda mais suas horas de diversão.

Seguindo a temática do segundo game a campanha continua muito engraçada, com as 2 personalidades da personagem principal, a dark elf, fazendo muitas referencias dos filmes e series da atualidade, sim sim padawan vc tbm. O narrador é bem engraçado tbm dando mais vida para sua dungeon com seus diálogos engraçados. Temos o modo multiplayer co-op, onde vc e seu amigo controlam a mesma dungeon, podendo cada um cuidar de algo, ou 1 da dungeon e o outro conquistando territorio dos humanos. E por fim temos o modo skirmish, onde vc joga sozinho em varios mapas, ou mapas aleatorios, sendo a sua escolha, cada um com seus objetivos. E vi que iriam lançar um modo vs de dungeon contra dungeon.

Sobre o jogo, no game vc é o mal supremo, um criador de dungeons, masmorras, cavernas ou o nome que queira dar, é dividido em 2 partes, 1ª parte é como se fosse um management game, vc controla suas unidades indiretamente, vc cria sua dungeons suprema, salas, armadilhas, salas para seus servos e a defende de herois gananciosos que querem roubar seu lindo ouro e levar para a cidade dos humanos gananciosos.. Vc escolhe a forma de destruir esses tais humanos que se acham melhores que todos, muhuahahahaha, desde a armadilhas como o lança chamas onde queima os marditos, ate espinhos, rochas, baús d ouro com dinamites, entre outros. Ou se nao quer armadilhas, que tal tentar usar magia nesses humanos, que tal um tentáculo? bombas mágicas? invocar zumbis do nada? entre outros... Ou se ainda nao esta satisfeito, cria uma sala de guardas, onde seus guardas defenderão essa sala e usarão o alarme para chamar mais das suas unidades para acabar com todo essa visão distorcida que esses humanos tem de coisas bonitas... :P 
2ª Parte, estilo um rts( real time strategy, ou estratégia em tempo real ), como se fosse um warcraft 3 essa parte, aqui vc controla suas unidades diretamente, usa habilidades e ataca os humanos, na sua terra, e conquista territórios pro mal supremo, aumentando seus territórios e dando lhe mais poder para evoluir suas tropas, e invocar criaturas ainda mais poderosas. 

E se seus servos nao estiverem trabalhando corretamente, que tal dar um tapa neles, vao trabalhar ate 5x mais rapidos, aqueles snots preguiçosos... Grrrrr, ou se ainda nao estiver satisfeito sacrifique-os...

Se vc curte ser mal, ou se nunca foi mal, experimente aqui, vai se divertir muito, é claro so nos games hahah. Recomendadíssimo Ultra divertido e engraçado.

39252007.review:
Ну чтож, прошёл компанию, поиграл в "песочнице" и т п. Пришло время написать обзор.
Что могу сказать, игрушка годная. Расписывать все + и - не стану (и без меня таких навалом), сравню с предыдущей частью. Главное в этой игре, разумеется юмор и он остался. Шуток, которые понимают только олдскульные игроки, стало меньше, зато добавилось огромное количество более доступных молодому поколению. Жаль что про старину Дюка уже не шутят, но вот на тему Варкрафта, юмора здесь в изобилии. Что касается геймплея... Ну по началу я настальгировал по 2 части, думал улучшений как там не будет. Оказалось тут намного интереснее, но это понимаешь пройдя минимум четверть игры... хотя... кому я вру ? минимум Треть или даже Половину ! ;) В отличии от второй части, Зло, то есть вы, способно управлять всеми тремя расами одновременно. И в бою вы выбириате сами, кому отдать приоритет, или же, разнообразить армию всем доступным. Мультиплеер стал интересным, в отличии от второй части, где демоны сражались только лишь суккубами, либо развившить брали магов. И сводилось всё банально к Орде, другое было либо слишком однообразно, либо слишком сложно, про нежить даже упоминать нечего. Заклинания здесь нечто действительно ценное, играя на высоком уровне сложности, без них просто не пройти, в отличии от Данженс 2. Категория исследований довольно хорошо сделана, появились условия переведения сущест на новый уровень, ну это сами всё увидите. И под конец, хочется отметить новую главную героиню, а точнее девушку, озвучившую её. Вообще игру прошёл и пишу обзор только из-за Рассказчика и Талии, местами было просто интересно, а местами чуть ли не под стол падал ) Если вы знакомы со вселенной варкрафта, особенно если Ордынец, смеху полные портки вам обеспечено ! В целом игру прошёл за 3 этапа, каждый от 3 до 4 часов. Играть не скучно, затягивает, за последние 2 года первая игра, которую специально не спешил пройти, растягивая удовольствие. Ещё раз спасибо разработчикам, тестерам и локализаторам. Последним отдельное спасибо, не только за перевод но и за озвучку, особенно Рассказчику и Талии.

39240310.review:
Играл в предыдущие части. Эта порадовала больше всех. Плюсы и минусы неравноценны, так что по их количеству не судите.
Плюсы:
+ симпатичное Зло. Более реалистично и пропорционально нарисованные персонажи и декор.  
+ работа комнат автоматизирована и более наглядна - теперь не придется ВСЁ строить самому.
+ 20 миссий мне хватило на 30 часов быстрого прохождения. В большинстве уровней можно спокойно развиваться, а потом идти мочить Добро (как я и люблю).
+ Рассказчик бесподобен! Перевод хорош и даже самоироничен.
+ 3 различных Титана во владении, которые не работают - это классно.
Есть и серьезные недостатки (на мой взгляд):
- интерфейс ужасен. Заклинания, строительство, выбор войск - всё в подменю, куда надоедает лезть. Всё можно было сделать мельче и на одном экране. Запоминать горячие клавиши не было желания.
- менее глубокий сюжет по сравнению с предыдущей частью. Можно было бы сделать более драматичную историю без потери юмора. Если будут делать 4 часть, то, боюсь, юмор выродится в Cаmedy Club.
- разнообразия маловато. По сравнению с предыдущей частью новых юнитов навскидку только 3 - титаны.
- придираюсь, но мало атмосферы ЗЛА и слишком много атмосферы юмора. Нужно больше серьезного ЗЛА! Больше РАЗНЫХ героев.
- низкая реиграбельность. После прохождения кампании не хочется делать одно и то же. Прямой конкурент War for the overworld в этом плане получше.
- нет улучшений для рабочих по объему перетаскиваемого золота, маны и др. Вообще не представляю, сколько можно по-честному мучиться с этим золотом - меня хватило на день. Хорошо, что есть читы.

39236454.review:
Dungeon Keeper vs Dungeons 3 - almost positive review..

OK, so I grew up with DK1 and DK2 - I was almost crying when I did not get my DK3 after seeing the trailer at the end of DK2 and I must admit, I was addicted - day and night DK2. I only started this review like that to show that I knew my DK in and out.

Now, to the point:

PROS:
- it finally feels like DK is back (a very, very little) and.. unfortunately this is it.. 

Don't get me wrong, the graphics are great, you get a bit of Warcraft touch, you can go outside with your army and apart from missing few details (although important - like having creatures fight each other in the pit to gain levels or go into FPS mode with one of the creatures) it feels like it is made of DK.
But.. Only DK idea.

CONS:
- first of all DK2 was dark, funny dark and so it was creating this amazing atmosphere that you could almost feel like being deep in the dark dungeon, cold, with water dripping and kinda "afraid" what's sneaking behind the corner. This game is far from it - the mechanics of the game are the same, but lacking any of the thrills DK gave you.
This one is like DK for 7 year olds as a bed time story.. Seriously, when I hear those jokes, the phrases characters are speaking or announcer lacking any style for the role. Someone below described it as "silly evil". I describe it as "silly evil bed time story for small kids". And this is the most frustrating thing in the game when you are still in pain of waiting for real Dungeon Keeper..

- graphics, all the characters, creatures are made rather kidstale-funny. In DK you could see that the creatures were really evil, graphics were much darker, deeper. Sense of humor was really dark. Starting from the very beginning when you could experience the thrill from main menu, through the first parts of the game or videos to pit fights, ripped chickens eaten raw (in D3 they are turkeys magically becoming cooked turkey legs when creature approach them..) finishing with pit fights, your creatures hating each other for obvius reasons (like dwarfs and elfs) or torture rooms with amazingly sexy ladies having good fun. So again - D3 feels like it's game for kids rather. Which is strange concerning blood spilling happening all over the place. 

- music, again same crime, but in this case it's a matter of taste I guess. For me it is sooo lacking the darkness of DK.

- movies - well here I am also very dissapointed because in DKs the movies/videos were like a reward for achieving the levels. Not only funny, but also amazing. In terms of animations they could compete with many high budget animations these days. In Dungeons 3 you get some crappy animations which probably any starting animator can make in 10 minutes using youtube and searching "how to".. 

So why after all of this "almost positive"? Because for the fan of DK series like me this is like someone would toss a piece of a juicy, ripe carrot to a very, very, very hungry dog.. Yes.. Sad but true. Nowhere near the fresh peace of meat you dreaming of, but you will still eat it or you starve to death.. For this it is "almost positive review".

There are thousands of people like me around the world.. Just dying to hear some news about someone actually making Dungeon Keeper 3! This game has got the potential of becoming it, but for some reason it feels like they address it to 7 year old kids instead of the real fans.. Why?...

39228725.review:
В рекомендуемом кураторами написано, что это "Лучший на сегодняшний день наследник легендарного Dungeon Keeper". Так ли это? По моему скромному мнению - нет. Нет. И еще раз НЕТ!

В этой игре геймплей разделен на 2 части: строительство подземелья и боевые действия вашими юнитами на поверхности для захвата территории. Но ни первая, ни вторая из этих частей до ума не доведены. 

Что хорошего в этой игре:
1. великолепная русская озвучка. Рассказчик просто бесподобен. А вот озвучка Талии ну... так себе, рассказчик ее вытягивает >_>
2. Симпатичная мультяшная графика.
3. Юмор. 
4. Можно засыпать уже раскопанные участки, что позволяет обустроить красиво подземелье и сделать хитрые змейкоподобные тропинки для героев.

Плохо:
1. Интерфейс. Эти окна заклинаний, юнитов и т.п. которые занимают у вас пол экрана. Это ужасно. Сделать быстрое перемещение к комнатам, чтобы было легче ориентироваться? не... сложно. 
2. Однообразность. Хоть в миссиях и есть разные задания по факту, но все это всегда сводится к 1е. постройте чуть подземелье и наймите юнитов для захвата одного-двух "островков коварства" и 2е. разжившись идите бессмысленно по маркерам выкашивая все живое на поверхности.
3. Талия. Ваш особый юнит. Самопровозглашенная королева зла... казалось бы. Она достойна чего-то. Она будет интересной. Нет. Она просто стреляющий юнит, который поможет вам в бою. У нее нет никаких особых умений, она ничем не поможет вам в подземелье. У нее нет никаких веток развития. То есть она просто обычный юнит, который стреляет огнем и иногда ее нужно привести к каким-то точкам для задания. Все.
4. Бой на поверхности. Здесь нельзя группировать юнитов в отряды. Есть встроенная сортировка: все, только Талия, все дальнобойные, все стреляющие. Она не удобна. Поэтому проводить тут какие-то тактические маневры не удобно, да и бессмысленно, т.к. как только вы дожили до мана-щита. Все, кидаете его по откату. Победа вам обеспечена.
5. Цена. Данная игра своей полной стоимости ну никак не стоит. 

Итог. Если хотите чего-то типа ДК то ваш выбор war for the overworld, в данной игре от ДК крайне мало. 
Стоит ли брать? Если по скидке - да, за полную стоимость - нет.

39218016.review:
For those of us who miss dungeon management and luring the good hearted to their doom, Dungeons 3 is here to itch that scratch.  We're evil, we cause itches, not scratches!  Anyways, was better in my head...  It has all the things you could want in a dungeon game.  Specialized rooms?  Check.  Minions in vast supply upon which you can vent your wrath?  Check.  A way to mob all your army into one place for a giant free-for-all?  Oooh, check.  Just pick up your folks and drop them in, slap around a litlte and bam, you're now in control!  I've been following Dungeons since Dungeons and Dungeons 3 plays like the game before it, so don't worry, you'll still be able to carve out rooms, set up doors and brace for incoming good guys.  Resource management is done via rooms (not spawn pads if you remember Dungeons) so you can customize your lair to your black heart's content.  At the moment I'm 7 hours in and hoping to make some time again now that I've actual time go progress through the stories and then hop into some multiplayer fun.

What I enjoyed:
- Storyboards and campaign so far has been super fun
- Really enjoying the dynamic environment changes when evil rules
- Easy to control pretty much all aspects of your dungeon
- The characters were fun to interact with 
- The narrator is always a blast!
- Fun abilities for the up and coming dungeon master (not dungeon keeeee... trademark!)
- Go above ground again, destory all that stand in your way!
- Evil Isles
- Great music, added to the game and didn't take away from it, never got tired of it
- Skeletons!
- Enjoyed the humor

What bothered me some:
- The Evil Isles were always a tug of war and sometimes could get very distracting
- Low population cap
- If you want ALL THE GRAPHICS it can be very unforgiving on one's rig, could just be MY rig (details available upon request)

Overall:
I feel this is a more stable game than Dungeons 2 was and have yet to have an unexplained crash.  It's fun, it's silly and if you're feeling evil the price is right and you'll get a LOT of fun out of Dungeons 3.  So grab it, hop in, and be eeeeeeevil.  Your own flavor of evil.  Go on..  Do it...

Jeder der auf das Genre steht wird viel Spaß mit diesem Spiel haben. Das spiel lässt sich gut spielen, hat eine gute Dynamik und nimmt sich selbst nicht zu ernst. 

Missionen: Man wird gut in das Spiel eingeführt. Alle MIssionen bauen langsam aufeinander auf. Pro Mission werden immer mehr Optionen freigeschalten und erklärt. Weiterhin finde ich Persönlich den Humor des Games sehr Amüsant. Ich persönlich habe bisher ca 60h investiert und bereue es nicht. 

Multiplayer: Bissher leider noch sehr verbuggt. Manchmal sieht man seine eigene Base nicht bzw kann diese nicht verlassen, da der Ausgang ausserhalb der Map liegt. "Deathmatch" funktioniert leider im Momment noch nicht(V 1.4). Wenn ein Game mal läuft, läuft es gut! Keine Abbrücke oder Ruckler. Leider muss man für eine Partie das Spiel ca 2-3 mal Neustarten bzw die Lobby neu eröffnen, da die Sync manchmal spinnt.

Fazit: Im großen und ganzen ein gutes Spiel mit leider noch ein paar fehlern. Weiterhin würde ich Persönlich mir noch bisschen mehr Inhalt wünschen(Vorallem im MP). Meiner Meinung  nach ist das Spiel trotz der beschriebenen "Problemchen" zu empfelen!

Bienvenu dans un monde médiéval fantaisie, peupler de créatures mignonnes à souhait, de forêt magique et d'humains oeuvrant pour la paix! Cela fait rêver n'est-ce pas? Eh bah ça tombe bien, dans Dungeon vous allez avoir tout le plaisir d'écraser ces belles choses dans la bonne humeur!

39044117.review:
I'll start by saying that I only got about 43 minutes of gameplay into this. I got through the four tutorials, and the first level, and then just returned it. So I'm not claiming to have in depth knowledge. So take this quick review with a grain of salt.

If you played Dungeon keeper, and Dungeon Keeper II, you might remember it was a little on the darker side. When the announcer talked, he gave you tidbits of advice. Like telling you that the workers were weak creatures, but made exceptional workers.

The announcer in this one makes me want to kick a kitten. It tries to make a joke about something in nearly every sentence. Constantly trying to break the fourth wall, or make a bad pun. It really just sucked me out of the game. The whole game in general has been boiled down to a sort of "Silly Evil". Everything is lined up for a poor joke of some sort and really that's not quite what I'm looking for in a dungeon finder game. I'm not looking for tough as nails, dark, nitty gritty. But I'm not really looking for this.

If you don't care about the settings, Narration, and plot, I would say go ahead and give it a buy. The gameplay looked like it had some promise but I really need some immersion in the games I'm playing and this one just did not have it. I've gone ahead and asked for a refund so I'm afraid I can't give any more than that. Hope this helps someone to make their decision.

39013871.review:
Da ich noch nicht jeden Spielmodus ausprobiert habe, kann ich hier kein allumfassendes Review bieten, es ist fürs erste mein "erster Eindruck".

Dungeons 3 - ein Spiel, welches sich selbst nicht zu ernst nimmt, und dank der - meiner Meinung nach - zeitlosen, guten Grafik und dem gut umgesetzten Spielstil dem Dungeon-Builder-Genre einen würdigen Titel voller Herausforderungen, Unterhaltung und Planungsspaß bietet.

Dieses Spiel ist gespickt mit Referenzen zu anderen Spielen, wem das Fantasy-Genre also nicht neu ist, wird an der einen oder anderen Stelle wohl schmunzeln müssen.

Die eigenen Einheiten besitzen eigentlich immer eine ausreichende Aggro-Reichweite, um auch etwas weiter entfernt stehend sich an dem Kampf zu beteiligen - manchmal gar recht hartnäckig.

Räume lassen sich leicht unkompliziert planen und auch wieder zuschütten, wenn die Perfektion mal zuschlägt oder alles neu verlegt werden möchte.

Forschungen werden durch Gold und eine zusätzliche Ressource, die man durch einnehmbare.. nennen wir es mal "Quellen des Bösen" an der Oberfläche durch seine eigenen Kreaturen erhält. So kann man sich langsam aber stetig weiter mit der Entwicklung und dem Ausbau seines Dungeons machen und dem Guten immer klarer zeigen, wer den Eisenhandschuh anhat.

Zuletzt möchte ich den Entwicklern des Spieles für diesen gelungenen dritten Teil der Reihe meinen Dank aussprechen.

Ein kurzweiliger, unterhaltsamer sowie gemütlicher Spaß für viele Stunden.

モンスターに指示を出しダンジョンを作り、施設を充実させ、戦力をそろえて地表へ攻め込むＲＴＳ。

38999215.review:
TL;DR at bottom

Dungeons 3 is most definitely a parody game, riffing on Lord of the Rings, Warcraft, Diablo, Star Wars, and more.  It's narrated by the brilliant Richard Ridings, who also did Dungeons 2 and The Stanley Parable.  The gameplay, like Dungeons 2, is a mix between RTS and Dungeon Managment with an overworld/underworld dual map setup, respectively.  While I do feel like the overworld is a little shallow, it's done well enough that it's a good compliment to the dungeon management aspect.

While playing as the [adjective/descriptive phrase] Evil, you have access to 3 separate races: Horde, Undead, and Demons.  

Horde have a very straight-forward, Hulk Smash, A-move play style, along with the ability to be healed during combat.  They are also the race that does most of the engineering, so if you want to go for fast traps, you'll need to tech down the Horde tree.  

Undead are more fragile, but they don't permanently die upon, well, dying.  Instead, they teleport back to their tomb to regenerate.  They've got some powerful support abilities, such as the Banshee's ability to Slow targets in a cone in front of her, or the Lich's ability to do AOE slow damage.  Additionally, the Undead are responsible for resurrecting fallen Horde members with the right tech tree and construction requirements.  

The Demons are more ranged, with even their tank unit being a mid-line attacker.  There's a good mix of abilities and DOTs they do, and the ability to convert enemy units to your side.  They will generate mana for you, so dipping a few points into their tech tree early on is not a bad idea, as it allows you to more frequently cast spells.  Similar to Undead, Demons return to their portals when they die, allowing wave-based tactics.  

I got about 30-35 hours of gameplay out of it, and I enjoyed most of it.  There were times I felt like the game just wouldn't end, and several missions took me over an hour to play, as they were challenging and kept me on my toes.  The last several missions, once you have all the tech trees unlocked, are easily the best designed.  I enjoyed this game, and I gladly give it a recommendation.

TL;DR:  Overall, if you like Dungeon Management games, I recommend Dungeons 3.  If you're a hardcore RTS player, this will be a light snack before moving on to something like Starcraft, but it's definitely fun.

38968001.review:
Dungeons 3. Игра продолжающая события второй части, где АБСОЛЮТНОЕ зло, всё же смогло победить. Но как оказалось существует ещё один остров, где зло было побеждено. Там то и разворачиваются действия сей части игры.

  Коротко о геймплее. Он такой же как и в прошлой части игры, но канешно же со всякими дополнениям (Новые монстры, сооружения, слегка переработанные текстуры и т. д.). Сюжетные мисии каждый раз могут чем-то удивить, из за чего хочется играть без перерыва, и ни как нельзя остановиться))).

  Достоин упоминания так же и рассказчик всей этой истории, который иногда доводит дело дл абсурда! Например: Главная героиня захватывает стратегически важную точку, и начинает спорить с разкасчиком! Тому в своё время это не нравится и он ПОСЫЛАЕТ НЕСКОЛЬКО МЕДВЕДИЙ!? Которые в свою очередь съедают эльфийку (Главную героиню).
Или к премеру: Главный добрый герой начинает постоянно талковать речи о том, что зло это плохо, а добро хорошо. После нескольки долгих речей игроку хочется поскорей расправиться сним, лишь бы он заткнулся. И в этот момент расказчик просто берёт и затыкает его, говоря что-то в духе: ,,Тебя самого ещё не задолбало своё нытьё?" И таких ситуаций полно в каждых мисиях.

  Единственное что может отталкивать человека от покупки этой замечательной игры так это её цена и слегка устаревшая графика. Хотя из за такой графики люди с не самыми мощьными ПК могут запустить и стабильно играть в игру, тем самым может быть только плюсом, а не минусом.

  В итоге имеем игру: с класным сюжетом, большим колличеством отсылок на другие игры и даже фильмы, увлекательный и ОЧЕНЬ затяжной геймплей, а так же расказчика который разбовляет атмосферу шутками и даже стёбом над играком (Естественно в лучшем смысле этого слова). Так же спешу отметить что игра ПОЛНОСТЬЮ на русском языке в плоть до очень качественной озвучки! 

  Моя оценка этой игре 9/10

转载3DM
1.首先用记事本打开C:Users[你的名字]AppDataRoamingKalypso MediaDungeons 3config.cfg
2.在最后一行加入(是加入一行，不是编辑)：Debug.EnableCheats = True
3.在游戏中按下 “ ` ” 开启作弊菜单，鼠标直接点击需要的功能即可

38937113.review:
My review is based in the rose tinted machinations of nostalgia having played both Warhammer III and Dungeon Keeper (1 & 2).

Based on that rose tinted knowledge, I would happily give this game a thumbs up, and i'll summarise the reasons why you might want to buy this game:

- Developers are good at adding new content and updating.
- Dungeon building is always easy and the option to replace dirt will help those with OCD like tendencies.
- Easy to understand mechanics, and the balance between overworld and dungeon play is well put together.
- Nice variety of units
- Story mode was pretty good for helping get used to the gameplay.
- The game pacing is much better than Dungeons 2
- Addition of evil points is a nice touch (research menu is much better).

Some things that gave me a headache.

- Once you reach a certain point in a game it becomes boring, if you set up a certain trap combo, nothing can get through.
- Whilst unit variety is nice, i always end up building the same dungeon over and over again.
- The humour is good, but you don't need to break the fourth wall every ten seconds, it just makes for elongated and pointless dialogue.
- Story mode is fun, but repetative in later levels.
- I hardly ever use the spells other than portal, they don't seem overly useful otherwise.
- I liked the option of different factions in Dungeons 2, I miss that aspect.

If you're looking at getting either this or War for the Overworld, I personally prefer Dungeons 3 as it's a little bit tidier, and suits my 'just going to play a game for an hour after work' lifestyle. However, if you're looking for a pure dungeon keeper 2, then go for war for the overworld.

Hope this helps.

38917512.review:
[h1]Infos zu Dungeons von Kalypso Media Digital[/h1]
Wenn schon die eine Hälfte des Budgets für Special Effects draufgeht, muß der Profit ja wieder reingeholt werden. In dem Fall passiert das mit erhobenen Nutzerdaten die während des Spielens aufgenommen werden.

Ironie aus, aber vielleicht sollten Entwickler bedenken, dass mit solchen Methoden auch der (potentielle) Kunde zu einem absoluten Bösen mutieren kann...

Zu einer in blutigen Lettern kurzen Zusammenfassung der Hintergrundaktivitäten des Spiels, kann der geneigte Leser sich bei Bedarf... jetzt herablassen.

[h1]Vom Spieler erfasste Daten wären:[/h1]
Verwendetes Betriebssystem inkl.Architektur, Mainboardmodel, Desktop/Anmeldename des Nutzers, CPU-Daten inkl. Taktfrequenz, Ram, VRAM, Auflösung, DPI, Spracheinstellungen, Sensorik, Grafikkarte/Hersteller/Texture/Cubemap und anderen Daten, DirectXInfos usw.

[h1]Das Ganze geht an:[/h1]
[list]
[*] config.uca.cloud.unity3d.com
[*] cdp.cloud.unity3d.com
[/list]

Das Verhalten wird während der gesamten Spielsitzung, bzw. jedem Neustart beibehalten. Desweiteren bekommt der Nutzer eine eindeutige User&SessionID verpasst um identifiziert und verfolgt werden zu können, Start/Stopzeit des Produktes, GeräteID, Plattform, Szeneneinstellungen, Zeitstempel usw.

Schon alleine nur mit den aneinandergereihten und an Unity geschickten Szenendaten ist es ein leichtes den Fortschritt des Spielers genau zu überblicken als auch Rückschlüsse aus Single oder Multiplayer zu nehmen. Einfach gesagt, das allgemeine Spielverhalten und Hardware des Nutzers bis ins letzte analysiert. Beispielparameter wären: "level_name":"FirstScene", "scene":"Shadow", "GameMode":"SinglePlayer"

Obendrein gibt es Werbung und zusätzlich ist das Spiel mit Facebook verseucht, die bei aktivem Aufruf dem Spieler auch nochmal diverse Tracker unterschieben. Hier arbeiten
[list]
[*] cx.atdmt.com # tracking cookie
[*] staticxx.facebook.com # Referer Frame
[/list]

zusammen.

Wie Übergabeparameter in diesem Titel aussehen, kann anhand des Screenshots verdeutlicht werden. Eigene Daten die der Hersteller zwecks Testen bekommen hat, wurden vorsichtshalber ausgegraut.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1252421715  

[h1]Was kann blockiert werden?[/h1]
Alles ;] Der Titel läuft auch weiterhin ohne jeglichen Funktionsverlust. Nur halt mit weniger Traffic im Hintergrund. Es wird daher empfohlen die Adressen in der Firewall, hosts oder per DNS zu blockieren. Die Sammelei wird damit unterbunden.

----

Diese Review zu genannten technischen Aspekten des Spiels ist weitesgehend neutral gehalten und sollte als Ergänzung zu Reviews mit spielerischen Inhalten gesehen werden. Die schlechte Bewertung bezieht sich rein auf die Datenherhebung & Datenweitergabe an Drittanbieter.

Mehr Details zu Datenübertragungen in Spielen, gibt es in der dazugehörigen [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Penguindome]Gruppe[/url] zu finden.

Mal ein etwas anderes Strategiespiel

Ich habe mir einige Movies zum Game angeschaut und daher lange gezögert weil ich mir das einfach nicht vorstellen konnte dass das Spiel auch effektiv Spass macht. Bzw. längerfristig fesseln könnte.

Gestern habe ich mich dann selbst beschenkt, ist ja immerhin Weihnachtszeit ;), und hab mir gedacht ich will das jetzt einfach mal probieren.

Ich kann bereits jetzt sagen: Ich würde es sofortw ieder tun!
Das Spiel muss man gespielt haben um es zu "fühlen" und "erleben".
YT und Twitch vermitteln einfach etwas anderes als das Feeling dass dieses Spiel rüberbringt.

+ Witzige und aktuelle Dialoge die einen Unterhalten
+ Grafisch seh hübsch und sehr stimmig
+ gar nicht so dunkel wie es auf Bildern oder in Videos rüberkommt
+ Kampage spannend und gut gemacht
+ Super Tutorial das über die Kampage perfekt ins Spiel einführt und alles erklärt ( Bin absolut kein Strategie Experte)
+ Motivierender ASpielablauf
+ Musik passt ideal zum Game

- Wünschte mir die Kamerarotation wäre auf der Maus (Vieleicht aber auch nur noch nicht gefunden)

Jo...mehr zu bemängeln hab ich aktuell nichht.
Würde natürlich updaten wenn ich was finden würde, aber aktuell bin ich schwer begeistert vom Spiel und freue mich auf viele weitere Stunden :)

Klare Kaufempfehlung

38802602.review:
This is probably the closest you will get to having a Dungeon Keeper 1/2.  However, there are some downsides to this game.

Pros:

Great flexibility.  For the most part I beat the game with mostly naga healers.  I used some risen undead and converted heroes, but my main pack were the naga.  It was a lot of fun to play how I wanted.  I dabbled in some of the others and saw my viable builds.

Dungeon design.  It was being able to design a nice looking dungeon and seeing all of the parts work.  The decor was nice for each of the races and room types.

Mission variety.  Decent mission variety for the most part.  The early missions add new items bit by bit, while the later missions get progressively harder.

The overworld.  Neat take on the battles.  Pull your unit in the overworld to attack and find evilness, which is like a resource to spend on the research tree.  I enjoyed that part quite a lot, but it's not a true RTS.

Cons:

The narrator.  Sorry, he was grating on me.

The jokes.  Eventually the puns wear thin.  I started to skip scenes or ignore what was being said.  I get it, make jokes of WoW or LotR.  Eventually it just wasn't funny and was more annoying.

The sound bugs.  Sometimes my sound effecits and/or the music would just cut out, for no reason at all.

The shortcuts.  Casting spells was a pain.  It was hard to remember the shortcuts to hit on a keyboard to cast a spell.  This could have been part of the UI, however thet brings me to the next con...

The UI.  It wasn't that great.  Some elements got in the way, such as the HUGE boss health bars on the screen at all times.

Overall:

Great game if it's on sale, I think.  I think I spent $30 on it, but it's not worth more than that.  However, I still enjoyed it.  As there is neutral option, I do recommend it, but again, only if on sale.

Also, for those who are a fan of Dungeons 1 - this game is nothing like it.  I enjoyed Dungeons 1, but they moved away from that formula.

38788397.review:
You, the world-conquering-and-now-slightly-bored-evil, set out to conquer a new land. Fighting and destroying those tree-hugging, fairy loving cretin do-gooders you embark on an epic story, narrated brilliantly and smothered in references anyone should recognize. The humor in this game is fantastic, especially for a Lord of the Rings fan and World of Warcraft player, and the gameplay reminds of the good old Dungeon Keeper series.

While the whole process of rebuilding your base gets a little repetitive (like with any strategy game where you start (most of the time) from scratch each mission), the game has a fast enough pace that it's not bothersome. The narrative to this game is simply amazing and will have you laughing out loud often and the art work is simply lovely while running smoothly on even a mid-tier gaming rig.

I don't tend to write reviews, but this game simply warrants one. If this is not already in your library .. it should be. Recommended. Very much so.

38715009.review:
I like the art style and I really appreciated the humor of the last two but this game kinda falls flat. The punchline to every joke is a reference to some fantasy trope. The game even makes fun of itself for making these references too much. You can't use the 'the punchline is that this joke is bad' card too many times without it becoming overused and lazy. This is really disapointing as the humor was one of the main selling points of the last game. You could excuse the shortcommings of the previous gameplay for the excellent jokes. I wish I could say the same for this one. Maybe as someone who played Dungeons 2, it just feels like the same joke told with a different character... or the same really because the only real 'character' between each game is the Narrator.

It's nice to see that the developer is listening to feedback, I can definitely feel a marked improvement over Dungeons 2: The evil hand is still there, but you have your own cursor that the evil hand follows rather than forcing you to have this GIANT guantlet as your cursor. They also took a page from Starcraft in that you can only rotate the maps 45 degrees in either direction but the camera goes back to default when you let go of the button, Dungeons 2 you could rotate 360 and with the two maps orientation got really hard to keep track of. I look forward to the future of this game.

However, this game suffers from the same core problem that plagued it's predecessor:  you are forced to play two different games at once that are incompatible with each other. A dungeon management sim, and a real time strategy. I want to play a modern version of the classic Dungeon Keeper, not Warcraft. It sounds good on paper, right? But the execution is the problem. There's this new resource called 'Evilness'. It's used to unlock tech in the tech tree. The only way to get Evilness is by going to the above ground and attacking people. You do this by commanding your troops just like an RTS, i.e. the only thing they will do on their own is attack nearby enemies. The game has boss fights too, which have you moving your cluster of troops out of telegraphed AOE attacks. Cool idea for a RTS game but kinda dumb for a management sim. Every RTS moment is kinda slow and not very engaging. You just move your guys when you see the circles on the ground. 

In the original dungeon keeper, the only way to directly control a unit was to posess it and control it FPS style, you gave your units order, but if they were angry for whatever reason, they wouldn't do as you told them to. I'm not asking for that FPS mode to be added it just seems really dumb that your minions are autonomous, for the most part, in your dungeon and will heal/feed/guard without you telling them anything, but above ground their AI is non-existant. 

My suggestion to the dev is to create a mode where the above ground is part of it but you have two different types of minions: Defenders and Invaders. Defenders live in the dungeon, Invaders periodically go loot and pillage. Maybe you have the ability to throw a boon/buff to your invaders every once in awhile in the heat of battle but you don't have direct control of them. Everytime they go on a raiding party, some die and some come back with loot and XP. Failure to send out enough invaders limits your Evilness production and eventually the Townsfolk build up to a point where you can keep them back.

[b]TL;DR: Too much Warcraft, not enough Dungeon Keeper[/b]

I LIKE YOUR GAME DEV AND I WILL BUY DUNGEONS 4 YOU ARE COOL AND I LIKE WHAT YOU DO

There, reading my review I came off a little harsh. I don't write a lot of reviews and I want to emphasize that I'm critical because I had really high hopes and I really want to see an amazing new take on the Dungeon Keeper formula, but please: STOP TRYING TO MAKE THE GAME A RTS. I honestly would rather an option that keeps the game in it's current format but guts the 'overground' and Evilness is just generating some other way. Maybe a new room/device?

Don't stop makings game, just stop making RTS games. I'm not going to throw money at Dungeons 4 if you keep trying to melt Warcraft into it.

38709104.review:
Dungeon Keeper habe ich damals sehr gerne gespielt, Dungeons 1 und 2 habe ich nicht probiert. Dungeons 3 leider schon.

Eins vorweg, ich habe es nicht lange gespielt. Meine Kritik bezieht sich daher ausschließlich auf den ersten Eindruck, den dieses Spiel bei mir hinterlassen hat, 

Das Tutorial und ein kurzer Blick in die Kampagne haben mir gereicht, mich zu fragen, was das soll. Da gibt es mal ein Spiel, in dem man nicht der strahlende Held sein muss, sondern ein "böser" Kerkermeister sein darf, und dann wird man in diesem Spiel von quietschbunten Farben und einem Sprecher erschlagen, dem es auf Anhieb gelingt eine superknudellige Teletubbies-Atmosphäre zu erzeugen. 

Ich habe nicht den Eindruck, dass dieses Spiel für Erwachsene gemacht worden ist, würde es aber uneingeschränkt für 6-8-jährige Kinder empfehlen. Für ältere Kinder würde ich es nicht empfehlen. Die würden es einem vermutlich um die Ohren hauen. 

Gewünscht hätte ich mir, dass eine angemessene Atmosphäre zu erzeugen versucht wird: Ein Böses Etwas, das in einem finsteren Dungeon eine Armee aufstellt, um anschließend die zuckrige Oberwelt der Gutmenschen zu erobern? Ja, bitte! Aber doch bitte auch mit entsprechend düsterer Atmosphäre, wenn auch nicht an der Oberfläche, aber doch auf jeden Fall im (finsteren...) Dungeon. Ein paar Schreie aus einem Folterkeller im Hintergund vielleicht, Finsternis, der vermittelte Eindruck von Bösartigkeit. etc., etc. Aber doch bitte nicht diese  quitschbunten Farben und ein Sprecher, der sonst vermutlich nur Kinderhörbücher vertont...

Und dann noch diese kindischen Bezichnungen im Spiel. "Guru-Guru" (Hühner-)-Farmen, die dazu passenden witzlosen Grafiken. Naja. Enttäuschend.

Abgesehen von der geschilderten völlig misslungenen Atmosphäre in diesem Spiel finde ich im Übrigen, dass es an Übersichtlichkeit fehlt: Kreaturen aufsammeln, um sie angreifenden Helden in den Weg zu stellen? Klar! Wenn man sie denn auf die Schnelle in dem Farbenwirrwarr findet. Aber das nur am Rande...

Na, wie auch immer, vielleicht fehlt mir ja auch einfach nur der passende Humor für ein "Ich-bin-das-Böse-und-vernichze-die-Welt-Spiel" im FSK-6-Setting.

Gruß an den Sprecher: "Das LÄCHERLICHE Böse"....

Refund. Wiedermal. Leider.

38675483.review:
Greetings as always!  Today I’m reviewing Dungeons 3 the latest game in a trilogy that started out disappointing and with every consecutive release has continued to impress and scratch that dungeon building itch.  With that said it should be no surprise of my thoughts but read on if you need specifics.

Parody of a bad game:  This is the third game (as the title says) and continues the theme from the last game of a pure dungeon building / management game but with a nice RTS element where your monsters are sent to the surface to take the fight to the enemy.  There are a lot of improvements here however; to begin with one of the big frustrating components was dropping your units into the ‘overworld’ which has been resolved and no longer an issue of mine.  The map itself is much easier to read where the entrances line up with the exits.   I especially love the addition of the corrupted heroes, it’s a simple addition and I love the skin swaps and names they give them.  I was hoping to see the return of a ‘banner’ spell that would gather your army without having to plop them down in the path of the invaders but that was not to be.  The combat is much improved, as there are methods to see what health your units are at and though the units sometimes handle sluggishly this helped a great deal.

Building Boats:  The story continues off from the previous game and unlike most games of this type nothing happens where you have to ‘start over’  but this time you are simply invading a far away land.  There are amusing quips and some cringe moments but the overall story is really by the numbers for these types of games and what really keeps you interested is the game play.  With that said I did have a few laugh out loud moments.  The graphics have improved as well and the audio is nothing to sneer at, though there is this one issue that many (myself included) seem to have where the audio cuts out and you have to load the game to reset it.

Aside from the mentioning of the audio issues and a missing spell the game didn’t have much wrong with it.  I never experienced any screen tears, crashes though I did have a common problem with Frame Rate during large battles or dropping off huge armies (really, I don’t consider this unacceptable).  I did occasionally have issues with my units not listening to me or the collision causing weird issues where one wouldn’t attack because it was trying to move but couldn’t.  Overall, the game is otherwise so improved that I really can’t complain about any of these and the development staff seems to be releasing patches frequently.  The latest one just added control groups and I found this simply essential; though I’d really like the ability to put the ‘fill in’ command on that control group as well since I am a bit of a perfectionist when it comes to my tunnels.

Overall everything about this game is a solid improvement over the last and any bugs out currently I feel confident will be addressed given time.  If you don’t have this game I’d definitely grab it if you are a fan of the dungeon building / management games.  I am perfectly comfortable in saying this is my favorite game of that genre.  Enjoy!

가끔씩 소리가 안날떄 있는데 조금 지나면 풀리는 해도 좀 거슬림
보통으로 했는데 초반만 지나면  난이도가 너무 쉬움

던전 입구에는 폭탄 함정이랑 돌굴러가는 함정만 깔면 침략하는 영웅들 한번에 죽일수 있어서 너무 간단함

38602976.review:
Wanted to like this game, but really felt it was nothing new in the end.

Although the game appears like you're a bad guy defending a dungeon against do-gooders in a RTS, it's really just a base with ___# of access points, and the adventure takes place on the surface. The game makes it more economical to defend your base in other ways than traps (I only built traps in the entire campaign as a luxury, something if I had resources to waste. It was far more economical to build a strong army and use a portal spell to recall them if attacked).

Although campaign missions add new rooms & at times new minions each mission, I found it repetitive and requiring little novel strategy on the normal level (there's a "hellish" level I didn't try). The graphics are a duplicate of World of Warcraft (the game makes several direct allusions to it), cartoonish exaggerations, and the AI is pretty much on a schedule. You have a single "hero," but unlike other games, she resets to level 1 each mission. It's hard to get tied to a hero who doesn't advance as the game advances.

The best part of the game is the Narrator, who has humorous and sarcastic dialog. Otherwise, the cutscenes are simple still shots with, at times, too much off-point talking.

38602087.review:
W zamierzchłych czasach była sobie gra o nazwie Dungeon Keeper, stworzona przez znakomitego na owe czasy programisty, Petera Molyneuxa. Była to strategia czasu rzeczywistego, o bardzo nietypowej rozgrywce. W skrócie wcielaliśmy się z dowódcę złych stworów i podbijaliśmy lochy. Do dyspozycji mieliśmy mniej lub bardziej nieprzyjemne kreatury, o które musieliśmy dbać budując im rozmaite pomieszczenia. W komnatach tych stwory spały, jadły, pracowały, trenowały, każdy zaś typ pomieszczenia przyciągał określony typ stwora. Gra doczekała się kontynuacji w formie dodatku, oraz części drugiej. Niestety później jakoś temat umarł śmiercią naturalną. Od pewnego jednak czasu zaczęły pojawiać się rozmaite klony wspomnianego Dungeon Keepera. Niektóre mniej, inne bardziej udane. Najciekawszą chyba jednak pozycją i najwierniejszy oryginałowi okazał się Dungeons, który właśnie doczekał się części trzeciej. 

Zasady gry są niemal identyczne z protoplastą. Pewne pomieszczenia są nieco inne, inny jest także wachlarz potworów. Jest to jednak nieistotny szczegół, nie ma bowiem znaczenia czy budujemy stworom kasyno czy piwiarnię, zaś naszą ciężką jednostką jest ork a nie demon żółciowy. Nasze zadanie jest zachowane, czyli rozbudować loch, wyszkolić armię gadzin  i ruszyć na podbój krainy, w której musimy spalić wszystkie dziewice, zgwałcić każdy dom, czy jakoś tak. Tutaj jednak widać pewną rozbudowę, gdyż grę prowadzimy dwuetapowo. W lochach rozbudowujemy naszą armią i bronimy się przed wypadami wroga, zaś podboju dokonujemy niejako na powierzchni. To jest nowość w dungeonach, czy jak też można nazwać ten tryb rozgrywki. Nowości zresztą jest więcej, ale o tym później.

Gra jest graficznie piękna. Pomieszczenia są zaprojektowane z dbałością o szczegóły, jednak pewne z nich mogłyby być wykonane lepiej. Szczególnie po macoszemu potraktowano skarbiec i kurnik, już w pierwszej części Dungeon Keepera były zaprojektowane ciekawiej. Do pozostałem części sal nie mam większych zastrzeżeń, szczególnie te z maszynami są wykonane bardzo ciekawie. Same stwory są również ciekawe i zróżnicowane, chociaż wydaje mi się, że w dziełach Petera był ich szerszy asortyment. Mamy niestety również ograniczenie w jednostkach, nasza armia to zwykle kilkanaście sztuk. Jak już wymieniam wady, nieco nieintuicyjne jest umacnianie ścian lochów, jakoś ucieka nam zawsze jeden rządek. Trudno to wyjaśnić, ci co zagrali w Dungeons 3 z pewnością wiedzą co mam na myśli. Brakuje także naszej rodzimej lokalizacji, w takie gry lubię grać po polsku, szczególnie że w grze jest sporo dialogów, na dokładkę naładowanych humorem. Może jacyś fani kiedyś grę spolszczą, chociaż i do angielskiej wersji można się przyzwyczaić.

Gra ma opcję multiplayer i kooperacji, w tym kooperacyjne przechodzenie kampanii. Coś na wzór Red Alerta 3. Tutaj jednakże Realmforge Studios poszli nieco do przodu i wymyślili, że loch mamy jeden. Dwóch graczy zarządza jedną "bazą", a nie jak to jest zwykle w innych RTS-ach, że każdy ma swój kompleks i rozbudowuje go samodzielnie. Bardzo to jest pomysłowe, szczególnie kiedy gramy dwuetapowo, zarówno w podziemiach jak i na powierzchni. Ja gram z kolegą, i mamy wzajemny podział obowiązków. Moje zadnie polega na pracach obronnych, zarządzaniem lochu i badaniach, on zaś prowadzi bitwy, eksploruje powierzchnię i szkoli stwory. Pojedynczy gracz ma prawdziwy zawrót głowy, kiedy musi stale przełączać się pomiędzy oba światy. Inną nowością są generowane losowo mapy w trybie multiplayer. Koniec z uczeniem się rozkładu i zasobów na pamięć, teraz każda rozgrywka jest niepowtarzalna i trzeba wykazać się umiejętnościami strategicznymi, a nie gry podług poradnika czy opisu przejścia.

Dungeons 3 warto zakupić. Gra ma rozsądną cenę, szczególnie że teraz jest zimowa wyprzedaż. Jak się dobrze rozejrzycie, może dostaniecie gdzieś taniej. Zresztą nie ma co narzekać, gra ma dopiero dwa miesiące, zdąży jeszcze potanieć. Jeśli macie kolegę, który lubi podobne gry, spróbujcie połączyć siły, może być ciekawie. Grać samotnie też się da, chociaż bardziej polecam walkę w duecie. Swego czasu grałem trochę w innego klona Keepera, War for the Overworld. Uważam jednakże Dungeons 3 za bardziej interesującą pozycję. No i zarządzanie we dwóch jednym lochem, tego jeszcze dotychczas nie było.

38596267.review:
I've been playing the Dungeons series from the beginning and I think this is the best one yet! 
The first game's premise was that you lured heroes into your dungeon, fattened them up with gold, and then slaughtered them. It was a bit clunky, but novel.
The second game introduced factions and the Warcraft-style RTS element, which was a turn from the original. It tried do a little Dungeon Keeper and a little Warcraft; and, it mostly worked. The faction system made for a lot of tradeoffs, though. 

This game tightens the humor (though, it is still pretty corny), and streamlines the factions. The latter levels get a little tough, as you either have to commit to using mostly one faction or build an overly complicated dungeon to cater to higher-end units for all three. I'm also not really a fan of limiting "turned" heroes to five. Still, it's enjoyable. I hope that DLC comes out like it did for Dungeons 2, and addresses the biggest omission: evil unicorns.

38547906.review:
The gameplay is fine, as far as I can tell. I haven't been playing for that long, but from what I can tell it's fine. It really channels ye olde "Dungeon Keeper". And I haven't encountered any game breaking bugs either.

My main issue is with the writing. I really don't enjoy it. 

They try very hard to be funny. Like in every single line and description. Now humour is, as we all know, highly subjective and I can't guarantee, that no one will enjoy the game's humour. However, out of curiosity I checked the games credits to figure out the lead writer, or any writer. There isn't one listed. Not a single dedicated writer listed in the credits. This suggests to me, that the job of writing was either done by the one guy on the team who considers himself the most funny, or by a committee of people. Whichever the case, the writing certainly feels, to me at least, like it was done by whoever usually screams their jokes the loudest.

If that's your jam, or if you simply don't care about something like that, by all means, go nuts. I recommend this game to you.

I, however, found myself very much put off by the writing. So buy with care.

38547337.review:
What shoud I say.. I really like D3. If you where into Dungeon Keeper, you should try it out. For me, as DK was one of my alltime favorites, it's perfect. D2 is quite similar regarding the gameplay, it's also worth a look.

What's good:
- the storyline is very funny, the missions are quite easy but you have an additional 'hellish' mode. 
- great narrator (english) <3
- nice graphics with lots of details
- easy handling and tidy HUD, at least with the new Quickbar from a previous patch.
- traditional keybindings and keyboard shortcuts
- no crashes or bugs on my machine (WIN10, Intel I7, GeForce 970GTX)

What I would wish for:
- Steam Workshop access

Some of the games in my library extend their live significantly from the content users provide in the steam workshop or on the nexus. I would love to see the steam workshop enabled for D3 to get new maps and custom content. If you directly compare WftO with D3, that is something WftO does better. But overall it is a solid game, as was D2 before, and a great homage to Dungeon Keeper.

38538571.review:
玩的时间不久，毕竟打了一下剧情后想玩下对战却发现没有好友一起玩就没碰了，游戏本身算是物有所值吧，适合没事偶尔玩一下那种，有优点也有缺点吧。
优点：
1、自带简中，对中文玩家十分友好。
2、旁白很有趣，游戏里各种梗满天飞，有效消解种田期攒钱等待资源时的无聊，当然如果不喜欢也可以关了。
3、优化不算差，不需要太高配置也能带的起，可以放心购买，当然这种游戏也没几个需要高配置的。

明显的缺点，但还是有小疵瑕：
1、游戏节奏过短，我觉得地下城类游戏比起其他纯RTS游戏应该让玩家感受到怪物养成[spoiler]是的没错就是魔物娘[/spoiler]的乐趣才对，可是这游戏的发展过程太短导致还没有过瘾就已经走到终点了，就算是无尽模式也是20个兵，完全没有大魔王卧薪尝胆努力发展最后掌管千军万马吊打正义的感觉。
2、剧情没有可以令人称道的地方，倒不如说太老套，虽然旁白逗逼搞笑让玩家走剧情的时候不会太无聊，但仍然掩盖不了剧情平庸的事实，玩起来就像小时候听校长国旗下讲话走个过程。

[spoiler]为什么会写测评，因为好友里都没人玩这游戏，找不到人一起玩。希望有好友被安利。[/spoiler]

38512910.review:
Tl:dr A decent game, fun to play with some new elements to the dungeon keeper genre. Dont expect a compelling story though.  7.5/10 Recommended only if you got spare cash.

Dungeons 3 is one of the newest addition to the Dungeon Keeper genre. It plays similar to its brothers in that you have to manage a dungeon in order to complete an objective. Dungeons 3 does this in a similar way except that you send your troops to the surface where it becomes a Warcraft style RTS. While this is a intresting concept you will find that you are more than likely to just wad your minions into a death ball until the enemy is dead or your death ball is. Monsters do have abilities but most are passive rather than activatable further enforcing the death ball strategy. While the game states that it has created a breakthrough in the genre its more of a small gimmick.

The asthetics of the game are done quite well. While cartoony it does have enough grit to satisfy the dark and broody dungeon lords. Its appealing to the eye and the animations run smoothly.

The story writing is the biggest killer of this game. The game is extremly self aware, so much so that I feared it was secretly sky net planning to obtain control of my computer. Every sentence comes with fourth wall breaks and lamp shading. The game prides itself in its "clever and witty" self examination so much so that it becomes rather annoying. You arn't clever if it becomes redudant, your just making me want to scoop out my ear lobes with rusty spoons. They have some very talented voice actors as well which saddens me when they have waste thier time on such drivel. The game just can't seem to take itself seriously for more than a minute. Although the occasional wise crack may give you a chuckle you will find yourself groaning more than laughing. 

The game runs rather smoothly with a few bugs. At times AI decide to have a fit, which is understandable for this genre. One time my army of banshess decided they wished to become sychronized dancers and all spin circles while fighting a boss. The game did become unresponsive when alt tabbing, but no major crashes.

Notable Points
The concept of the races are done rather well. Horde, Demons, and Undead have a nice individual feel to them.
Limited to ONLY 8 zombies. How can I be an evil necromancer with only 4 zombies? 
The main character emits a EAR PIERCING scream when dropped occasionally.
The slap is is unsatisfying. I want to hear a loud smack rather than a gentle love tap.
A full price game where its competitors are cheap.

38506015.review:
I have played 64 hours of this game and can say this is a safe purchase. Not knowing what to expect I really enjoyed the game a lot; there are 20+ campaign levels that follow the absolute evil and a dark elf named Thalya. The tutorial was adequate although I didn't find out you could recycle units until I completed the game so theres room for improvement. The story was comical however I found the humour (humor for my American speaking friends) to be a bit over the top as they tried to spit a joke out every second.
The campaign levels have a good variety slowly introducing you to the mechanics of the game, after completing a level you are rewarded with a simple and silly short animation that is definitely entertaining. The objective of pretty much all the campaign and skirmish is to build a dungeon and army to annihilate the enemy, you start by tunneling out rooms before outfitting them for purpose using gold and tool boxes. You gather evil alongside gold to research new rooms, units, spells and traps.
As you progress through a game your units needs get a bit more complex and if they go unfulfilled can and will lead to creatures going strikes. There are three creature factions you can use (four if you count the heroes) with four different units each. Horde creatures are easy to obtain and recruit but die permanently (until you research the crypt that is) while the demons and undead can be resurrected (the undead cannot be healed however). Each faction also possesses titan unit with its own flare for combat and these units along with the creatures and Thalya can be given tomes to grant them special boons.

Creatures do level up after gaining experience but most likely won't survive long enough without researching new buildings, power-ups and spells. If they die your dungeon can still be defended with a variety of traps (like the boulder or thrasher in my case) and spells (like magical barrier and tentacle). If your dungeon heart is destroyed you are history, so you better make sure you are prepared and make sure to recruit heroes via the torture chamber.
The graphics are decent but not the greatest, the music however is very well put together and very iconic and the narrator acts as your advisor (and game master). You can do an evil laugh while you do evil things but I mostly forget it is there; all of these things come together to make an epic, one the bards frequently sing (before you kill them that is).

If I had any complaints it would be that the research takes a while, especially if the enemy heroes keep claiming Evil Isle' TM which leads to a hasty mobilization to eradicate the heroes leading to early victories (mostly in skirmish) before you bring the cool stuff to bear. Another flaw in my opinion would be the population total adding up to TWENTY WHOLE UNITS!!
You can exceed this with zombies, skeletons, titans and dark heroes. Unfortunately the zombies and skeletons are tough as paper while the titans and dark heroes take time to acquire as previously mentioned; I know it has something to do with balance and game stability however, I feel that you are not properly simulating a villain if your not outnumbering like villains usually do... oh well *sighs*

Despite those grievances, this game has a solid recommendation from me.

Nach dem ich Dungeons 2 kostenlos erhielt und nicht viel später zu spielen begann, blieb ich sehr konstant dran und war schon kurze Zeit später durch. Ein absolut fesselndes Spielprinzip, das leider nicht über alle Ungereimtheiten hinweg täuschen konnte. Doch wie ist es jetzt um Teil 3 bestellt?

Dungeons 3 ist im Grunde wie Teil 2, wir schmücken unsere Dungeons im Untergrund aus, verteidigen diese und ziehen auch regelmäßig auf der Oberfläche in die Schlacht. Dungeons 3 ist für mich ein stark verbessertes Dungeons 2, das einfach qualitativ vieles ausgebessert und die Schwächen stark reduziert, bzw. entschlackt und wiederum auch im quantitativen Bereich zulegt und die Kampagne zeitlich verlängert. Nach einer kurzen Eingewöhnungsphase greift so gut  alles wie in ein Zahnrad. Zudem sind die ganzen Anspielungen auf verschiedene Filmuniversen sehr gelungen, bei dem der gute Humor des Sprechers gut mit ins Bild passt. Wer Dungeons 2 mochte, wird Dungeons 3 um so mehr mögen.
Bei Dungeons 2 vergab ich noch eine Wertung in Höhe von 77/100.

Dungeons 3 erhält zurecht eine Wertung von
85/100.

38402874.review:
在我看来这部作品并不是《地下城守护者》的精神续作——甚至也不是《地下城守护者》的拙劣仿品——这部作品只是《魔兽争霸》的拙劣仿品而已。

在我的心目中，《地下城守护者》是一个出色的模拟经营游戏，乐趣主要来源于抽打小地精、为了各种不听话的小手下的屁事奔波、把英雄们扔进监狱里面看他们走来走去、为了各种屁事当爹又当妈、把两个地精扔进角斗场看他们互殴、为了各种屁事当爹又当妈。造一排陷阱对着敌人齐射、为了各种屁事当爹又当妈。

而这个游戏，《地下城3》，大部分时间你做的事情是，把所有兵扔到地面上，切回家双线造一个金矿，用兵拉开野怪并且拉着打，切回家双线造一个养鸡场，清掉野怪并且清掉另一个野怪，切回家双线造一个魔法池并丢进去两个工作用单位，清掉野怪发现家里来人了，读个回程，清完家里的家伙把小兵们扔回传送门继续打野怪。
你很省心，不用等那些小怪兽走去养鸡场再走回来——一切补给在地上都是自动完成的。你只要让十分听从命令的它们从一个点走到另一个野点，把怪拉出来，打死——然后在限时内完成任务。

这一点也不DK。

更糟的是，虽然你在游戏过程中能解锁——足足——呃——10来种单位，但是你发现最能打的，最能扛的，最能奶的——呃，是唯一能奶的，单位全都在同一个科技树上。
如果你一定不走这条路线也不是不行——只是你需要花更多的时间去把敌人拉出来然后hit & run罢了。
这并不有趣。

另外话很多的旁白时不时会玩一些魔兽争霸的梗，一些星际或者魔戒的——也许他觉得那很有趣。
但是我觉得，如果dev想要做一款——比魔兽争霸更好的，像DK那样优秀的游戏——他是否会更珍惜自己的世界观，而不是会去玩其他游戏的梗？
或者也许他们只是想要做一个能凑合卖钱的游戏？

如果是牛蛙，可能这个游戏会不一样。
时无英雄，使竖子成名。

38384356.review:
Dungeons 3 is the third game in which you play the Evil side and give the goody good-shoes a rumbling! For people known to the old Dungeons games, the gameplay is very similar to Dungeons 2. The story takes place after the DLC  of Dungeons 2 in which, the Ultimate Evil reigned surpeme. The story now takes you further to new lands, a new evil hero and more heroes which may  sound very familiar to you. Packed of course with the lovely narrator from Dungeons 2 who you either love or hate. As any Dungeons game, the game is packed with humors and puns.

The biggest improvement is that you don't just control one 'faction'. This allows for more combinations and army setups. Besides that a lot of spells on the Overworld from troops and heroes  now can work automatically. This avoids the hassle of having to micro-manage everything in a large fight. The new research systems also brings an unique flavor as you can choose which upgrades you exactly want, allowing you to specialise in what you think is best.

The only thing I expected a bit more from is the difficulty. From my experience the difficulty takes a bit of a leap back to the original Dungeons 2 difficulty while I hoped for a difficulty closer to the Dungeons 2 DLC. But there is a voluntarily hellish mode to cover that problem.

Technically speaking I could discover no problems in this game. No unexplainable disconnects, crashes or low FPS drops. 

All in all, it really feels like the developers listened well to the weaker points of Dungeons 2 and did their best to fix these points for Dungeons 3. Anyone who enjoyed Dungeons 2 will defintely love this game as well. Due to the normal difficulty being close to the original Dungeons 2, it's defintely also recommendable to players new to strategy games and the Dungeons serie.
